revision.text: ==Maltese== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|mt|scn|ciumi}} (“river”, plural {{m|scn|ciùmira}}), or rather a related southern Italian form (''[[ciumara]], [[sciumara]]'').<ref>Wortatlas der arabischen Dialekte, Band I: Mensch, Natur, Flora und Fauna. Brill, 2010.</ref> Ultimately from {{der|mt|la|flūmen}}. Though Maltese has replaced many, even everyday words with Romance borrowings, in this case it must be remembered that there are no rivers nor permanent brooks in Malta. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|mt|/ˈʃmaː.ra/}} ===Noun=== {{mt-noun|g=f|p=xmajjar}} # [[river]] ===References=== <references/>
